name: Mom's Best Spaghetti Sauce
author: KRAZYBARB
summary: A simple, slow cooked, authentic spaghetti sauce, as good as the restaurants serve...or better!  The secret ingredient is baking soda, but do not taste the sauce right after adding it.  Wait a while, and this sauce will not disappoint you.  It is good right from the stove, but the flavors blend overnight.  Best served with your favorite meatball recipe, where the meatballs cook in the sauce the last half hour.  Be prepared to take a nap after eating.
directions: Mix together whole tomatoes, tomato sauce, tomato paste, water, mushrooms, onions, garlic, sugar, salt and pepper, basil, and 1 pinch of baking soda in a large saucepan
Reduce to a simmer, and cook for 4 hours minimum
Stir in another pinch of baking soda; the sauce will foam
Simmer, stirring occasionally, until thick and almost brown
Make sure to scrape the sides of the pan in to the sauce
After the sauce is fork consistency, stir in Parmesan cheese
Watch that the cheese does not burn
If it is too tangy or acidic, add another pinch of baking soda and simmer another 1/2 hour
The next day, reheat and serve
